text: how do I set up development network with 8 peers?
you can extend what's in devnet-setup  . Alternatively, take a look at the docker-compose files in either ./bddtests or ./consensus/docker-compose-files
also, a few folks on hyperledger slack have published tools to deploy hyperledger/fabric using docker.  See if you can seach the various channel for "docker"
<@U12AHQ3NK>:   take a look at the technical-discuss listserv as well. Latest entries discuss a docker setup.  (sign up to the listserv from the hyperledger project web page )
can we just pipe these mails into slack?
<@U0XR6J961>, we need Richard Stallman to join :simple_smile:    but seriously, <@U0KM61BCP> can the listserv and slack be linked ?
<@U0XR6J961>: <@U0UGH3X7X> that was supposedly being worked by LF… <@U0UHG4VP1> <@U0PTU8XN3>  any chance we could integrate the technical-discuss mailing list into this slack? Also, too, IRC…

<@U112NNFV4>: We would like enhance the “Building outside of Vagrant” section of the current top-level README.md. “We” being the POWER development team, the reason being to make the instructions more complete and comprehensive, and also point out portability issues when running on POWER. I know that you are in the process of restructuring the docs. How do you suggest we proceed?  With the current structure I believe that this topic deserves its own .md file.

<@U0N1D1UAE>: we will definitely want to have multiple architectures supported… when we transition to Jenkins, we will start looking closely at that. Any changes we can affect to make that future transition smoother would be welcome
ideally building outside of vagrant would just be `go build`
with maybe a script to install go, rocksdb, and docker
while running docker-compose to create network i get the following error.:  ERROR: Container command 'fabric' not found or does not exist.
